comments.comment:
Madhuka; I am offering you some specialist advice. You do not have even PR status in the UK. The new Prime Minister of the Conservative government thanked the Tamil Diaspora in his victory-speech; therefore UK will not offer you even PR status because that will offend the Tamil Diaspora.
However, because the LIVES of you and your parents are under political threat, all of you are eligible for refugee status in Switzerland which is the only western country not under the spell of the Tamil Diaspora. But for that you will have to prove that you have been engaged in journalist activities that antagonized the new President and his illegitimate government. Working for Lake House does not make you a journalist. From what you say, you seem to be an IT specialist there managing websites.
In addition, you and your parents will have to put up a facade to show that you are deranged due to the threat for life if you want to travel to Switzerland by an air ambulance. Your facial expressions on you-tube will not pass a lie-detector test. The President of Sri Lanka will not object to Switzerland taking over your family because that will save him the cost of murdering you and your parents.
If you can take along with you the video clips of the Lake House CCTV recordings, you can hand it over to Nishantha de Silva Kandappa to augment the evidence he took about war crimes against the Rajapakses. Nishantha will make your life comfortable in beautiful Switzerland. But, bear in mind, Switzerland is not as beautiful as neighbouring Austria that is the birth-place of the ugly Hitler.
comments.author: Siri DE Alwis

comments.comment:
Dear Madhuka:
I am sure you know that a conflict between a journalist and a trade unionist has nothing to do press freedom of a country. You do not say that the conflict was due to anything something you said or did against the President or the PM or the ‚ÄúPohottuwa‚Äù. But you portray your conflict as an act of aggression against press-freedom of a HITLER-like dictator and his ILLEGITIMATE government.  You did not sacrifice the good life of the UK to come here to serve the country but to service the UNP. That is why you resigned from the job the day after the UNP lost. 

Your matter should have been dealt with locally with the low-level authorities. You left behind the comforts of a western country. You, as a journalist, know very well their campaign against Sri Lanka. Your taking the matter to international media has tarnished the image of the country, which the President is trying to repair, not because he fears the West, but because he loves this country and has great plans to attract foreign investment and tourism. You have cleverly played into the hands of western evil and betrayed the country that you repeatedly said you love. 

Your problem is that the trade union leader belongs to the ‚ÄúPohottuwa‚Äù and therefore your conflict was of a government against press-freedom. You also think so high of yourself that the President must personally intervene. Please note that some 6.9 million voters were behind the President and he has no control over all of them. The president and the downsized cabinet have a yeoman‚Äôs job in hand in hand to pull out the country from its morass.  The President has clearly expressed his policy on press freedom and is not responsible for every incident in the country at this early stage of his tenure. He inherited a corrupt system from the government that you came from the UK to serve. He is clearly cleaning it up. Please be more sympathetic and give him a break.

You seem to know what is recorded on the CCTV. You also expressed your knowledge of the camera locations and also what is recorded in the system. Though you had been managing the system, the system and its data are the property of the institution and not yours. You say that the system has recorded the incident and that means you have accessed the system for your private use AFTER the incident. This is tantamount to trespass. 

You are saying that you and your family are facing threats to their lives. This is surely a clever attempt to get refugee visa for your entire family from the UK High Commission and probably get you across by air ambulance just as attempted by the Swiss Embassy.
comments.author: Siri DE Alwis
